page.title: 18GREAT CANFIELD PARK
page.content: There are several interesting houses in the area dating back over the centuries. One of these is Great Canfield Park which was built in 1456 by the Earl of Oxford who owned much of the land in these pats. Originally the house was a hunting lodge in a deer park. In the 17th century the house was acquired by the Maynard family and remained in their hands until it was bought in 1928 by the late General Claud Charlton, High Sherriff of Essex. The Charlton family still live at the Park and have played a very important and active role in the development of Takeley as it is today.
